intro: Cyrtandra × paris, commonly known as the hybrid Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant belonging to the Gesneriaceae family. It is a naturally occurring hybrid between Cyrtandra and Paris, two genera within the same family. The plant typically exhibits a combination of traits from both parent species, including leaf morphology and flower structure. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia and is often found in moist, shaded forest habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
